playn.core
Interface Mouse

All Known Implementing Classes:
MouseImpl, MouseStub
public interface Mouse

Input-device interface for mouse events. This interface is for mice and supports buttons and the scroll wheel.

Nested Class Summary
static class Mouse.Adapter
          A Mouse.Listener implementation with NOOP stubs provided for each method.
static interface Mouse.ButtonEvent
          An event dispatched when a button is pressed.
static class Mouse.LayerAdapter
          A Mouse.LayerListener implementation with NOOP stubs provided for each method.
static interface Mouse.LayerListener
          An interface for listening to mouse events that interact with a single layer.
static interface Mouse.Listener
          An interface for listening to all mouse events.
static interface Mouse.MotionEvent
          An event dispatched when the mouse is moved.
static interface Mouse.WheelEvent
          An event dispatched when the mouse wheel is scrolled.
 
Field Summary
static int BUTTON_LEFT
          Used by Mouse.ButtonEvent to indicate that the left button is pressed.
static int BUTTON_MIDDLE
          Used by Mouse.ButtonEvent to indicate that the middle button is pressed.
static int BUTTON_RIGHT
          Used by Mouse.ButtonEvent to indicate that the right button is pressed.
 
Method Summary
 boolean hasMouse()
          Returns true if the underlying platform supports mouse interaction.
 boolean isEnabled()
          Returns true if mouse interaction is enabled, false if not.
 boolean isLocked()
          True if the mouse is locked.
 boolean isLockSupported()
          True if lock has a chance of success on this platform (the user may still block it, or detection may be broken for some browsers).
 Mouse.Listener listener()
          Returns the currently configured global mouse listener, or null.

          Lock the mouse, i.e.

          Allows mouse interaction to be temporarily disabled.

          Sets the listener that will receive mouse events.
 void unlock()

Used by Mouse.ButtonEvent to indicate that the left button is pressed.

BUTTON_RIGHT

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

hasMouse

boolean hasMouse()
Returns true if the underlying platform supports mouse interaction. If this method returns false, listeners may still be registered with this service but they will never be notified.

isEnabled

boolean isEnabled()
Returns true if mouse interaction is enabled, false if not. Interaction is enabled by default. See setEnabled(boolean).

setEnabled

void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
Allows mouse interaction to be temporarily disabled. No mouse events will be dispatched whilst this big switch is in the off position.

listener

Mouse.Listener listener()
Returns the currently configured global mouse listener, or null.

setListener

void setListener(Mouse.Listener listener)
Sets the listener that will receive mouse events. Setting the listener to null will cause mouse events to stop being fired.

lock

void lock()
Lock the mouse, i.e. receive mouse events even when the mouse pointer leaves the window.

unlock

void unlock()
Unlock the mouse.

isLocked

boolean isLocked()
True if the mouse is locked.

isLockSupported

boolean isLockSupported()
True if lock has a chance of success on this platform (the user may still block it, or detection may be broken for some browsers).
